flow.descriptionCdata:
c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.0e0c4734-dc4d-48c9-964d-f38a14ef6b18.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Responses\:
    success
    failure
c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.1fd733e2-6dae-41b7-be34-70e77d59b637.prompt=VMWare Host\: c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.2702e29c-6bad-4d81-a875-96ce0c73594d.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Responses\:
    success
    failure
c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.2b0a7502-5ef9-4799-9ca6-5fa8c1a93ce0.description=
Search for VMWare objects of type propsType and their properties (propsPathset) from a root object (if any) specified by propsRootObj and propsRootObj. Retrieve each object's properties one at a time from an initial search query as the one used for the SQL Query operation. Please see VMWare Integration Guide for more details.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
propsType - VMWare properties type (Task, Datacenter, VirtualMachine, etc.) to filter on. Type of object results desired.
propsPathset - Property filter's pathset, comma-delimited (eg. name, info.name, runtime.host)
propsRootObjType - VMWare object type (eg. VirtualMachine, HostSystem, ComputeResource,ResourcePool,Alarm)
propsRootObj - VMWare object ID

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - there are no more results to retrieve.

Returns\:
numberOfResults - Number of results from the query remaining to be retrieved
returnResult - Query result item or operation result
c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.48da5ee8-db3c-44bc-8691-e3559f1e3767.prompt=VMWare Host\: c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.6d5d0a63-356a-42d7-85d3-f72d0620a520.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.ac47725b-045f-4a0a-951e-7f662e4c94a7.description=
Search for VMWare objects of type propsType and their properties (propsPathset) from a root object (if any) specified by propsRootObj and propsRootObj. Retrieve each object's properties one at a time from an initial search query as the one used for the SQL Query operation. Please see VMWare Integration Guide for more details.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
propsType - VMWare properties type (Task, Datacenter, VirtualMachine, etc.) to filter on. Type of object results desired.
propsPathset - Property filter's pathset, comma-delimited (eg. name, info.name, runtime.host)
propsRootObjType - VMWare object type (eg. VirtualMachine, HostSystem, ComputeResource,ResourcePool,Alarm)
propsRootObj - VMWare object ID

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - there are no more results to retrieve.

Returns\:
numberOfResults - Number of results from the query remaining to be retrieved
returnResult - Query result item or operation result
c7db51bf-fbcd-4fcf-b1f4-cad74286a789.dbd906e3-5a44-4cec-b827-9d5a2d3cfaf3.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

flow.name: Get Capacity Info for VM
